reviews.review: Killing floor starts off slow but in the end i will take you in...not all the people in KF are going to be nice to you but don't let that stop you, you'll make friends on here and that is what make me keep playing that and the achievements.

Killing Floor, or as it was known by it's development title, London Banking Simulator 2009, presents a startling accurate depiction of the modern British central banking system.

You play as a wealthy day trader who must eviscerate the local British population in exchange for the money they drop from their corpses. After each round, you gather with your mates at the local trading floor and spend money on largely unprofitable, high risk weapons arbitrate, or engage in old school day trading, throwing cash and shouting such inspired phrases as "MONAY, MONAY, MONAY", and "DOSH, grab it while you can lads". The complexity of English financial services boggles the mind.

The graphics are top notch; a true to life representation of the state of modern England and her subjects. However, I am inclined to say the vanity of developers came through when they gave the enemy NPCs uncommonly good dental hygene. Having traveled to the UK myself, the enemy mobs are comparable to what a typical Briton would consider to be a supermodel.

Even still, the honest presentation of British finance and culture set the game apart: 10/10
Fun game, simple and easy to understand. Also love the soundtrack.

This game stands above most other survival games and "horde modes" for a few reasons: 1. A class system of sorts where you can improve with even the most basic of equipment. 2. A variety of weapons that are pleasing to use. 3. Interesting enemy design and nice ways to blow their heads off. 4. I TOLD YOU, I AM WELDING THIS DOAH.

Игра в бывшем мод на [i]Unreal Tournament[/i], в настоящем отдельный проэкт на движке Анриал, который по праву можно назвать лучшим. Это своего рода сын гениального отца, покаривший мир с немалым успехом, но в своей области! Если хотите без удержную массу адреналина, и почувствовать себя героем боевика, где бравые ребята зачищают мир от полчища тварей? Это для вас! Так что решайте сами, или вы пойдёте один как Джон Рэмбо и почувствуете весь шквал [b]дерьма[/b], который на вас выльеться, или бойцом спец отряда, где все плечём к плечу, решайте сами;) оценка игре [u]10/10[/u] Ибо к таму что графика прекрасно вписываеться в антураж игры, и не малеёшего раздражения глаза, от некого мыльного кинца не испытываеш! 
Если вы являетесь фанатом серии [spoiler] Serious Sam [/spoiler] то игра вам будет по душе 100%

И игра этойже кампании [url=store.steampowered.com/app/35450/] Red Orchestra 2 [/url] передаёт невероятный дух второй мировой! Советую! Тоже [u]10/10[/u]! Но про неё отдельно!

Вся суть данной игры является уничтожение надвигающихся волн мутантов и так до тех пор, пока не появится "Патриарх". В игре отличный саундтрек, достаточное количество оружия, множество игровых классов, простая, но, в тоже время, долгая система прокачки. Мутанты отличаются друг от друга не только внешностью и размером здоровья, но и особыми способностями. Хочется добавить ещё то, что карты сделаны превосходно, они создают особую атмосферу хоррора. 
 В эту игру стоит лучше играть в группе друзей, так как это, прежде всего - "Треш, угар и содомия". Действительно, играя в группе ты можешь как-то расслабиться и вдоволь повеселиться. Отличная игра, всем советую ^_^

This may be one of my favourite games of all time. I would say that this is my favourite coop shooter, yes it beats Left 4 Dead, and is up there as one of my favourite online shooters, with the likes of Counter-Strike and Battlefield. The feeling of the guns are probably the best in any FPS that I have played. This is a game that I have spent many hours on so far and I will spend many more hours to come, it's just a game I can never get tired of. Killing Floor is a game that I would say you absolutely need if you like playing fun online coop-ish shooters on your PC. Are you still reading this? Why aren't you playing Killing Floor?!

Experience on Linux so far:

+ Solid gameplay, I don't think the game has ever crashed for me.
- Gamma and brightness does not work, prepare for a dark experience.
- bug causes nvidia driver to show hidden enemies. (great cheat, weakens gameplay)
- Audio breaks on some maps under certain conditions. (Farm is one of those maps)
- Better, but still not optimal: lacking optimization for the graphics. This is painfully obvious on maps like Steamland which is unplayable due to frequent framerate-drops.
- Steam friend invite/join server doesn't work making it hard to join friends. (always get server not responding)
- bugs aren't being fixed, instead we get new maps and DLC weapons. Fix bugs plz..


The game:
In my oppinion one of the best co op games ever! The theme is very cliche, calling them "specimens" instead of "zombies" does not help that. This game does however offer a tactical depth that few other shooters can match.
Many noobs will think that the best strategy is to stay in a corner while experienced players know that is only a fast way to get cornered and killed. That said, some spots are better for last stands than others, you need to organize your team to defend all possible entrances.
The game is class based (perk based) with each class having a set of specialities that translate to in-game bonuses. Waves of enemies will spawn, your job is to kill them all. In between waves you purchase weapons and upgrades using money you get from kills or donations from nice team mates who clean the maps using mad shooting skills. 
The game has no crosshair and relies heavily on the player knowing when the shoulder/aim a weapon and when to leg it. The aim is highly affected by any movement, you'll need to learn how to shoulder the weapons quickly to minimize spread.
This game is loads of fun! And I'm not alone in thinking so, servers are still highly populated, yay!

Score:
3/5 (fix the bugs and get 5/5)

Undeserving of its C rating, the simplicity of this game compliments the tactical gameplay of a supporting team and though it may not look the prettiest is definately a favorite. However, the leveling takes far too long even though it is out of 6 (7 since you start at 0) levels, the very nature of the level requirements is rather laborous. (Repair 5,000 doors to full health? No Problem!) This is in part rectified by the increasing health of the specimens per difficulty, doing 5 million damage may seem like a lot at first, but when the most basic zed has 228 health at max difficulty it isnt too awful, and the levels grant huge bonuses to price, ammo, damage and more.

This goes on sale often enough to be a low risk buy. If you like it you'll love it and even if you dont you cant deny its quality.

Killing floor is a great game to play with friends. It is also a money hole for DLC, which is why I find it so hard to recommend. I bought this game when it was fairly new. I didn't mind so much when they added skins because I didn't feel like I needed to buy them but the weapon DLCs hit my loyalty to this game pretty hard. All in all I do recommend it if you want a fun game to play with your friends but don't be surprised if you feel a little under-appreciated as a customer later.

There isn't really much of a learning curve to this, so anybody can pick up and play this. You kill things, basically, go to a trader between rounds, rinse and repeat until you make it to a boss at the end. Hopefully you survive.

A subpar co-op survival FPS that is weighed down by a terrible community and pointless DLC.

The Unreal Tournament 2004 mod (and running on the same engine, still)), Killing Floor is now a full-fledged game all of its own. 

Killing Floor does not do a lot, but it does it well. The idea is simple- you and up to six other people go and clear a map of all the ZEDs (the official name for the game's monsters- they're basically zombies for most intents and purposes). After each wave, you have a limited time to find the Trader to buy and sell weapons and restock your ammo. When the timer elapses, her doors shut and then you're left to fend for yourselves and kill another wave of zombies. This culminates in the final battle against the Patriarch. 

There are a few things going for the game. It's class-based, and it has a progressive levelling system. The more you play, the more experience towards a level-up you'll get, making you stronger. It's a simple idea to keep you coming back for more. Enemy variety is great- they all have strengths and weaknesses much like the player classes. From the invisible Stalker to the fireball-shooting Husk to the fearsome monstrosity the Fleshpound, it keeps the game feeling fresher for longer. 

The game looks perhaps a bit dated (it runs on a 2004 engine, after all), depending on your set-up, but it's very visceral. Hack s zombie's head off their neck, and they'll spurt blood, for instance. Headshots will often make brain matter explode out of them in a gory fountain. Shooting high explosives at them reduces them to a bloody mist that feels very satisfying. 

The greatest strength to the game, though, is the gunplay. Weapons feel weighty and punchy. Guns handle well- there's no crosshair, so use aim-down-sights effectively unless you practice a lot with hip-firing. Guns handle well because they have kick- they will move about from where you pointed them if you keep your finger on the trigger, much like a real gun. Some of the best gunplay in a shooter.

Another great asset to the game is that it balances difficulty and co-operation well. It's natural to assume you fight more zombies (which you get two dozen or more at a time on screen) with more players, but zombie health will also go up, in addition to the difficulty you fight on. It's a fantastic way of high-risk, high-reward, since levelling up is often dependent on the total damage your class has inflicted. 

Killing Floor has seasonal Summer, Halloween and Christmas event to liven things up, and it receives regular updates as well as some free content such as new weapons in addition to all the maintenance- weapon balance and so on. 

It's a game that's a bit of a one-trick pony in that it's a wave-based shooter- that's all it does, but it does that exceptionally well. It's a master of its craft.

Killing Floor is an Action Packed Horror Game that allows you to just have the most possible fun in an FPS! The game features a number of weapons, maps, and even a shop to buy new guns useing in-game cash! You can weld doors shut, but be careful as the horrorible monsters can break down the door and if there's enough of them, it won't take long. The shop can also be very useful on the hardest gamemode. This game is a survival game that just brings some fun into gaming.

-CSxKING AKA Bentenz5, Youtuber
Ok.. Im going to make this review short and simple.... IF YOU LIKE ZOMBIE KILLING, GET THIS GAME NOW!

At first glance people might not take interest in this game at all. But once they play it I'm pretty damn sure they'll be smashingly surprised! This is sooo much more than survival mode in Left 4 Dead and soooo much more than zombie mode in CoD. There's a surprising amount of immersion and there are constantly moments of panick and playing this game alone would probably be quite scary for most people. I've played it for 3.4 hours currently and I have maybe progressed 0.5-1% through the 7 different classes that are in the game (maybe more with DLC?). I don't think there is anything negative at all in this game that I can think of except maybe the final boss in the final wave which are just boring and weird usually. And also the weird Trader girl which seems to be talking about a lot more than "big guns". So yeah, either you like the play style or you don't, gameplay wise there is NOTHING to complain about. Team play is also 100% key in this game.

To me, this game is a combination of COD:Nazi Zombies and Left 4 Dead.  You, and 6 other players hold off a position against legions of "specimens" and the goal is to survive 4-10 waves.  There are constant updates and there are plenty of servers with players.  There are a bunch of things in the work shop and a good community.  Only con I can think of is that every now and then some maps don't download.  Other than that it's an amazing game.
